availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Jefferson Ford (Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Mariah Edwards Ford in Wood County, Kentucky, on May 12, 1845. Father of William Ford, Waller Ford, Dora Ford, and Ida Ford. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 281A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 125.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 950.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 520B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Midway, p. 477A.
Kentucky Marriage Records (1783-1965), Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, KY, Woodford County Marriages, Film 000252320.
Kentucky Historical Society, Kentucky Cemetery Records Project, Henry County, vol. 2 (Frankfort, KY: Kentucky Historical Society).
